comments.creator: info@arkadia.it
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; it; rv:1.8.0.9) Gecko/20061206 Firefox/1.5.0.9
Build Identifier: Firefox 1.5 / 2.0

We was testing our new e-commerce site on Firefox 1.5 / 2.0 and we noticed that when an image is "broken" (like the Internet Explorer shows a red "X") Firefox reloads the page two times. We noticed that in the Confirm Order Page of our site, because we found two similar orders did at the distance of 10-20 milliseconds. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a session variable, like this in PHP : 
<?php
session_start();
$_SESSION['BUG']=0;
print ('img src="img_not_exist.gif" />');
$_SESSION['BUG']++;
print ($_SESSION['BUG']);
?>
2.Show the page 
3.Delete $_SESSION['BUG']=0;
4.Reload the page. The increment will be of 2 instead of 1.
Actual Results:  
The browser reload the page two times.

Expected Results:  
The browser had to reload the page one time

...

comments.text: arcadia, can you mention if this still happens in Firefox 3.5? If not, please resolve this bug as a duplicate of bug 444931
comments.raw_text: arcadia, can you mention if this still happens in Firefox 3.5? If not, please resolve this bug as a duplicate of bug 444931
comments.creator: mardeg@inbox.ru

comments.text:
This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode
comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com

comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
